intro: [WRONG START] Emelia microcalyx, commonly known as the small-fruited embelia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes other aromatic plants like eucalyptus. The plant is characterized by its small, greenish-white flowers and elliptical, glossy leaves. Its fruits are small, dry capsules that contain several seeds. It is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
